description: Seven people detained by the South Sudanese authorities last month after being accused of plotting a coup against President Salva Kiir have been transferred to Kenya, President Uhuru Kenyatta said.
title: South Sudan Transfers Seven Detainees to Kenya After Probe Ends

description: Somaliland, a breakaway territory in northern Somalia, has a gross domestic product of $1.4 billion with a “high” income gap between rich and poor, according to the World Bank’s first economic output estimate.
title: World Bank Gets First Measure of ‘Unequal’ Somaliland Economy

description: Kenya will buy more than 300,000 metric tons of fuel including gasoil, gasoline and jet fuel for February and March delivery, according to bidding documents obtained by Bloomberg News.
title: Kenya to Buy More Than 300,000 Tons of Fuel From Five Suppliers

description: Amer Khan says he could sense a stock market rally in late 2012 just from the street scene in Dubai, the financial capital of the United Arab Emirates. Tourists were once again jostling for a spot from which to watch the dancing fountains that adorn the downtown area. Recurring traffic jams, increasing retail sales and a rise in airport passengers were other signals for Khan, the senior executive officer at Dubai-based Shuaa Asset Management.
title: Qatar, China Top Ranking of Frontier and Emerging Markets

description: Boru Sora stood in front of a pile of tree trunks and rocks in the middle of the road as he explained why he and other residents of his village in northern Kenya are blocking a key trade route to neighboring Ethiopia.
title: Kenyan Energy Bonanza Fans Violence in Arid Northern Region

description: When more than 90 percent of of the prices and trading volume is down, the market is in clear retreat.
title: Friday Was a 90/90 Day and What It Means

description: A Kenyan court ruled that a Chinese man who admitted to smuggling ivory will serve seven years in jail if he fails to pay a $230,000 fine, according to the country’s wildlife authority.
title: Kenyan Court Imposes Maximum Fine on Chinese Ivory Smuggler

description: General Electric Co. Chief Executive Officer Jeffrey Immelt urged private investors to provide more funding for health care in African nations, where government-run services are overstretched.
title: GE’s Immelt Urges More Private Investment in Africa Health Care

description: Lions in Nairobi National Park have been fitted with satellite tracking collars to alert authorities when they stray into residential areas in a bid to prevent conflicts with humans, Kenya Wildlife Services said.
title: Kenya Tracks Lions to Prevent Conflicts With Livestock Herders

description: Kenya selected 22 bidders to compete for the development of a 960-megawatt coal-fired power plant and a 700-megawatt natural gas-powered facility in the east of the country, Energy Secretary Davis Chirchir said.
title: Kenya Selects Tata, Sinohydro Among 22 Bids for Power Plants
